ncochran.model

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • ncochran.model.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Line>

    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Line>
    The Line class contains a choice, a horizontal position, and the edges associated with this Line and is used to determine the rankings of the Choices.
    Author:
    Nigel Cochran

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(int xPosition)
      This method creates a new Line based upon a horizontal location.
      Line(java.lang.String choice)
      This method creates a new Line with only a choice.

      This method checks to see if a height of an Edge is too close to the Edges already associated with the Line.
      int compareTo(Line o)
      This method is for sorting and compares a desired Line to this Line and returns the difference of the horizontal locations.

      This method returns the Choice for this Line.

      • Line

        public Line(int xPosition)
        This method creates a new Line based upon a horizontal location.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - The horizontal location of the desired Line

      • Line

        public Line(java.lang.String choice)
        This method creates a new Line with only a choice. This method is used to make test cases easier to write.
        Parameters:
        choice - String The desired Choice

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(Edge edge)
        This method adds an Edge to the Line.
        Parameters:
        edge - Edge The desired Edge to be added to the Line

      • sortEdges

        public void sortEdges()
        This method sorts the Edges from lowest to highest based upon height.

      • checkCloseEdge

        public boolean checkCloseEdge(int height)
        This method checks to see if a height of an Edge is too close to the Edges already associated with the Line.
        Parameters:
        height - int The height of an Edge.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the height is too close to an existing Edge. False if it is a valid Edge and is not too close.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(int i)
        This method returns the Edge stored at the desired location of the Line.
        Parameters:
        i - int The desired location
        Returns:
        Edge The Edge at the desired location

      • getEdges

        public java.util.ArrayList<Edge> getEdges()
        This method returns all of the Edges associated with this Line.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The array list of all of the Edges

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Line o)
        This method is for sorting and compares a desired Line to this Line and returns the difference of the horizontal locations.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Line>
        Parameters:
        o - Line The Line to have its horizontal location compared to this Line
        Returns:
        int The difference between the two Lines (this Line minus the desired Line)
